article: Things of Value Our area was just a few miles from the largest wildfire in Colorado's history. We were on "evacuation alert ". If we got the _ to evacuate, we would have to leave immediately. We _ suitcases with some clothes and set them by the door. We didn't _ these things were valuable, but time was. We moved the computers, with which I wrote for newspapers and made a _ . We took family pictures off the _ and packed them in boxes. These were truly valuable and could not be replaced. Then we took a hard look at all that _ . There was a lamp that belonged to my great grandmother. It was a _ to my family. And there was the piano my wife _ to play when she was a little girl. Not of great _ in itself, but another family connection. It was impractical to move everything from our home and store them for an indefinite time. Some important items would have to stay behind. The thought of leaving behind something passed down from our families saddened me deeply, even though I'd never been much attached to things. It's about what they _ --family and love. They each had a(n) _ to tell, and some of them spoke in the _ of our parents and grandparents. The fire _ reached our home. We were lucky. And though I felt grateful that all was _ , I also realized just how fortunate I had been in another way . I saw just how rich my life had been. Someone _ said, "There are people so poor that the only thing they have is money." And now I _ I was indeed rich. I was rich in family, rich in memories, rich in everything that really _ to me. I am wealthier than I ever believed possible. It took a fire to teach me, I wonder if there is any other kind of wealth worth seeking.
